first_reading.title: Book of Jeremiah
first_reading.text:
[[Jr 17,5]]Thus says the LORD: Cursed is the man who trusts in human beings, who seeks his strength in flesh, whose heart turns away from the LORD.
[[Jr 17,6]]He is like a barren bush in the desert that enjoys no change of season, But stands in a lava waste, a salt and empty earth.
[[Jr 17,7]]Blessed is the man who trusts in the LORD, whose hope is the LORD.
[[Jr 17,8]]He is like a tree planted beside the waters that stretches out its roots to the stream: It fears not the heat when it comes, its leaves stay green; In the year of drought it shows no distress, but still bears fruit.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 6,17]]And he came down with them and stood on a stretch of level ground. A great crowd of his disciples and a large number of the people from all Judea and Jerusalem and the coastal region of Tyre and Sidon
[[Lc 6,20]]And raising his eyes toward his disciples he said: "Blessed are you who are poor, for the kingdom of God is yours.
[[Lc 6,21]]Blessed are you who are now hungry, for you will be satisfied. Blessed are you who are now weeping, for you will laugh.
[[Lc 6,22]]Blessed are you when people hate you, and when they exclude and insult you, and denounce your name as evil on account of the Son of Man.
[[Lc 6,23]]Rejoice and leap for joy on that day! Behold, your reward will be great in heaven. For their ancestors treated the prophets in the same way.
[[Lc 6,24]]But woe to you who are rich, for you have received your consolation.
[[Lc 6,25]]But woe to you who are filled now, for you will be hungry. Woe to you who laugh now, for you will grieve and weep.
[[Lc 6,26]]Woe to you when all speak well of you, for their ancestors treated the false prophets in this way.‚Äù

second_reading.title: First Letter to the Corinthians
second_reading.text:
[[1_Co 15,12]]Brothers and sisters : If Christ is preached as raised from the dead, how can some among you say there is no resurrection of the dead?
[[1_Co 15,16]]For if the dead are not raised, neither has Christ been raised,
[[1_Co 15,17]]and if Christ has not been raised, your faith is vain; you are still in your sins.
[[1_Co 15,18]]Then those who have fallen asleep in Christ have perished.
[[1_Co 15,19]]If for this life only we have hoped in Christ, we are the most pitiable people of all.
[[1_Co 15,20]]But now Christ has been raised from the dead, the firstfruits of those who have fallen asleep.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 1,1]]Blessed the man who follows not 
the counsel of the wicked 
Nor walks in the way of sinners, 
nor sits in the company of the insolent,
[[Ps 1,2]]But delights in the law of the LORD 
and meditates on his law day and night.

[[Ps 1,3]]He is like a tree 
planted near running water, 
that yields its fruit in due season, 
and whose leaves never fade. 
Whatever he does, prospers.

[[Ps 1,4]]Not so, the wicked, not so; 
they are like chaff which the wind drives away.
[[Ps 1,6]]For the LORD watches over the way of the just,
but the way of the wicked vanishes.
